variables.label: MinIO Version
variables.description: Check out their Docker page for the valid tags https://hub.docker.com/r/minio/minio/tags/

variables.label: MinIO Root User Access Key
variables.description: Access key for `MINIO_ROOT_USER`. If unset, minio defaults to `minioadmin`. MinIO strongly recommends specifying a unique, long, and random value for all environments.

variables.label: Minio Secret Key
variables.description: Secret key for `MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD`. If unset, minio defaults to `minioadmin`. MinIO strongly recommends specifying a unique, long, and random value for all environments.

instructions.start: MinIO is a High Performance Object Storage released under GNU Affero General Public License v3.0.  It is API compatible with Amazon S3 cloud storage service.
instructions.end:
‚úÖ  MinIO has been deployed!
--------------------------------------------
_MinIO has been successfully deployed! Be sure to read the next steps below before attempting to access https://$$cap_appname.$$cap_root_domain._

--------------------------------------------
‚ùóÔ∏è **IMPORTANT**: Before launching MinIO be sure to change the following settings:

**Step 1**: Go to the settings for `$$cap_appname` and `$$cap_appname-api`
**Step 2**: Enable **HTTPS**
**Step 3**: Enable **Websocket Support**

üîê Dashboard access uses the keys set during deployment. If left blank, MinIO sets the keys by default to _minioadmin_.

**Access Key**: $$cap_access_key
**Secret Key**: $$cap_secret_key

üåê After completing the steps above, you can access MinIO at:

**Dashboard**: https://$$cap_appname.$$cap_root_domain
**S3 API Endpoint**: https://$$cap_appname-api.$$cap_root_domain

--------------------------------------------
üî∞ More information on initial configuration can be found at https://docs.min.io/docs/minio-docker-quickstart-guide.html

description: MinIO is a cloud storage server compatible with Amazon S3
